dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, dear... She manages to moves his hand to her mouth and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know your own strength, my love. And then, just as quickly, August's expression softens, relaxes, almost into sadness...as if he's about to cry....Marlena senses it immediately. She whispers loving

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie? August stops and eyes the bed beyond them. He leaves Marl and throws himself face first on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Jacob. Jacob watches as Marlena attends to August, lifting his l onto the bed, taking off his shoes. August begins snoring
Marlena smooths the hair out of his face then closes the curtains and returns to Jacob in the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right? Marlena puts a finger to lip and keeps it there, as she returns to her Victrola and selects another record. She cranks it on and plays it low. A RUTH ETTING SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. He's just had too much to drink, that's all. I hope you had a good time tonight. I wanted so much to make things up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight was your idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Auggie wanted it too, he felt horrible about what happened. He really does like you Jacob. But it's hard for him. He's under a lot of pressure. He does more than people realize holding things together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's true... (Opens her arms to him.) One dance before you go? Jacob cautiously approaches. Marlena takes his hands but Jacob presses closely against her and places his hand aga her bare back, he almost swoons. They slow dance. Both ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jankowski is Polish isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, sorry...I just think it's interesting. I don't know what I am, besides August's wife....I grew up in foster homes since I was a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kentucky, Oklahoma, Kansas, Texas...I must have covered a dozen states by the time I was 17. I'd make up stories about who my parents were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was five, I pretended for a whole year my mother was an Appaloosa mare... They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did! ... and I pretended that I was really an Appaloosa filly...and that I was just dreaming I was a girl and one day, I'd wake up...and I'd run home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I was a lot safer inside those stables than I ever was inside those homes... Marlena stops, not wanting to continue. Jacob finds a new route for her conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened at 17?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a parade for the circus. At the head, there were six black Fresians, 17 hands high wearing red tassles. So proud! So beautiful. And August was leading them. The second he looked at me, the way he looked at me, I knew I'd never live with strangers again. And the way he talked. Told me "I'd find a home in every city..welcomed in every town...and he'd give me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a life most suckers can't dream of"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, you too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful lie, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he said he'd make me a Star Attraction and he did. I'm pretty lucky he found me. Jacob, lost in her eyes and her voice, blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was pretty lucky to find you. Marlena is surprised by the compliment...and endeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sweet to say so. Beat. Feeling exposed, Jacob searches to change the subje

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him what happened... Jacob takes this as an intimate moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no Marlena, I won't ever tell. Marlena smiles, laughs, using Jacob's joke back on him;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the name of the song. "Don't Tell Him What Happened To Me". Ruth Etting. She's one of my favorites. Jacob's head starts spinning. Marlena takes care of him;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you much of a wine drinker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that? Marlena laughs. Jacob's bow tie is undone - she ties it;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me...We can't let you go out there all untied. A circus is a small town. What will people say? As Marlena ties his tie, Jacob's eyes simply rest on Marlena's face - sinking deeper in love. When Marlena finishes, she looks up to Jacob...She can tell Jacob is enamoured. She smiles warmly, touching his cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet, sweet Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lowers her hand) Good night. Marlena turns and disappears behind the velvet curtain. J stands still for a moment, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk Jacob sees the ring stock car door open, filled w people's legs hanging out and loud voices from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob hops up into the car. Kinko is giving a party, with bottle in his hand and drunken hospitality on his face. Thirty performers cram the area usually occupied by Marle horses, including BARBARA and another Coochie girl, NELL. Kinko and Queenie are performing tricks. Jacob watches. H admires the talent and humor of Kinko and Queenie's act. the end, the girls laugh and applaud. Jacob joins in:

dialogues.speaker: BRAVA QUEENIE
dialogues.text: But the sound of Jacob's voice immediately makes Queenie and growl at him. Jacob stops. Kinko, Barbara and the Coochie girls stop laughing and st the drunken young man, with his shirt out of his pants. H ripe for the picking! They get an idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB MY FRIEND!! Folks, this is my friend and roommate Jacob. I'd like you all to make him feel at home! Kinko starts laughing uncontrollably and before Jacob can protest or escape, Barbara and Nell approach him, moving for the kill. Blurry-eyed, Jacob staggers back but the ot refuse to let him leave. In fact, he is picked up bodily, raised above their heads and transported to Silver Star's empty stall as Barbara and Nell disrobe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinko opens the lid of a trunk, speaking to someone insid

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where am I? Kinko moves about a car filled with racks of costumes, pr and an open trunk containing the hidden Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you right now or where are you in an Aristotelean context because right now you're in a trunk. Inside the trunk, O.S. Jacob lifts his arm to Camera and discovers he is dressed in a red silk dressing gown...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are my clothes? I'm not wearing anything underneath this---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh-huh. As Jacob struggles out of the trunk, we only see his arms

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell did I do last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threw up on Barbara...And maybe Nell.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a little pale. Kinko holds the mirror to Jacob. We see for the first tim JACOB'S FACE HAS BEEN PAINTED AS A CLOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob races through each car - past musicians, clowns and Coochie Girls - clutching his robe, rubbing the make-up o Along the way, the circus company taunt and tease him wit sexy hoots and hollers. Kinko follows him, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having cleaned up, Jacob is dressing in his own clothes. Kinko sits on his cot "reading Shakespeare" with a melan Queenie at his side. When Jacob scratches his shaven ball

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your balls itchy?

dialogues.speaker: YES THANK YOU
dialogues.text: Pissed off, Jacob continues to dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll grow back. Aw come on, you still store about last night? Now I figure we're even. In fact, I probably owe you one. Feel free to borrow a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just drop it. Kinko opens a book to read. Jacob notices Queenie's quiet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Queenie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "wrong"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean she's not hating me. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Concerned, pets her) Yeah, she's been like this all day. I don't know...she must have eaten something. She did her business and it was kind of...watery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stool? Did you look at it for parasites?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like looking at my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some honey from the cookhouse. And if you can find any slippery elm powder. But the honey should do it. If not, we'll check her for parasites. Jacob starts to exit. As Kinko reads his book;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure Kinko. He moves to exit again. Kinko never looks up from book;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real name's Walter. They never look at each other but a friendship is formed. Jacob exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Jacob hops out, he sees performers and roustabouts a gathered by a performer train car, huddling and discussin He crosses to investigate, meeting up with August Diamond and Mr. Erwin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got big trouble. Lucinda died. Now we've got no center ring star act and no sideshow star...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she die?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ERWIN
dialogues.text: I don't know where we're gonna find a fat lady this late in the season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care where you find one, but find one. (To Diamond Joe) Better get some kind of rig set up to lift her out of the car. How did you carry Silver Star out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes... (considers for a second) Mmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, of course, don't be silly! Right. Well, figure something else out Joe but get it down for the performance. Put her in the hippo tank for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better start on that elephant. We need her performing yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the darkness of her car, the enormous elephant emerges, being led down a ramp by Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob - cleaned, dressed and hung over - sits crossed leg in front of Rosie. The two stare at each other. Rosie's n searching the ground for something to eat. Jacob, without energy or focus, his head pounding, orders her;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie...Up. Rosie just looks at him without moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. Rosie. Up. Rosie's trunk starts to sniff around Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie....Walk!...STEP!..Rosie STEP! Rosie's trunk investigates Jacob's body, tapping his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie please. My hair hurts. Rosie's trunk snakes around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...No more Cracker Jack until you do something....Rosie!... Rosie curls her trunk around Jacob and slowly topples him sideways, turning him over as he weakly threatens;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting really mad now....I mean it...Rosie stop... Rosie gets the Cracker Jack from his back pocket...

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You just can't get enough of somebody in your pants, can you? Jacob quickly gets up as August strides towards him;

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST
dialogues.text: Heard you had a rough night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does everybody know what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can somebody tell me? August suppresses a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm opening the midway and the menagerie this afternoon for some extra cash before the show tomorrow night. We'll see how she does with the crowd. She got any skills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding food? But I don't really know how to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, you can't do anything with a bull without the bull hook. August takes the BULL HOOK from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way to train them. Watch. Jacob steps back.

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: August stabs Rosie behind the shoulder..Jacob winces. Ros lifts her foot a little.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHER UP...UP
dialogues.text: August keeps jabbing her with the hook...dotting her fles with blood. Jacob gets upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, there's got to be another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have the time! She has to start earning her keep MOVE! UP!

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: August stabs her other shoulder...harder...continuing to shout. Rosie is getting agitated...pulling away from him constrained by her chain. Her eyes fearful. Other performers rehearsing in the area begin to watch as August strikes Rosie harder and harder. She begins to ble Jacob tries to stop August by going for the bull hook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, August, let me try again. But August angrily pulls it away and turns on Jacob:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me my business! You don't want to watch this, get the hell out! Making love to it ain't going to work. Besides, from what I hear, you're not that good at it.

dialogues.speaker: GET UP
dialogues.text: Jacob watches, upset and furious at August's treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie's flesh is dotted with wounds from August's bull ho Jacob is applying zinc ointment to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry girl. Just a few more here. Hold still. The un-staked canvas flaps behind Rosie wave up with the breeze....Rosie's trunk rises. She smells something from outside the tent. When Jacob bends down for more ointment, Rosie tries to t around but her chain is still staked into the ground. As Jacob straightens up, he sees: Rosie's trunk carefully wrap itself around the stake and it up out of the ground....She then manages to turn herse around, her butt to Jacob. Rosie's trunk then dives down up under the canvas flaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAT OF LEMONADE LEFT ON THE CONCESSION STAND, which is the process of being dismantled. Work men are carrying it back to the train. WE SEE: Rosie's trunk come out from under the canvas, her body hidden, searching for the lemonade. Jacob peers out to see: Rosie's trunk dip itself into the of lemonade and drink the entire contents. Jacob is amazed. He looks around: Workmen are some distan away loading the train. No one else sees her. Rosie finishes then turns back into the menagerie. INT. MENAGERIE TENT - TUXEDO PARK, NY - CONTINUOUS - DAY. Rosie's trunk gathers up the stake and then stakes it bac into the ground. Jacob can't believe his eyes. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train travels to Weekhawken, New Jersey...Jacob is looking out of open car to NYC skyline across the river.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We were on our way to the Manhattan/ Jersey show and Mr. Erwin still hadn't found a fat lady. Tickets sales were low. So August, ha,ha...August pulled a hat trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August is sitting atop Rosie, smiling, waving his top hat then forlornly placing it against his chest and lowering head in respect for Lucinda. Manhattan is in the distance

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A parade like you never saw, a funeral and a celebration, saying goodbye to one star, introducing a new one...playing those rubes dying to get a peek like he was rolling a coin over his finger tips... Rosie leads a small parade of clowns, including Walter an perky, healthy Queenie down the main street. Marlena sits atop a Percheron, in full costume. Jacob walks astride. Lucinda's Wagon, carrying "the dead Lucinda", follows.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't really Lucinda in there. It was Barbara in a fat suit and wig inside the hippo den. We buried the real Lucinda by the railroad tracks between towns. Cemeteries cost too much. We were the only family she knew. People line up to cheer and offer their silent respects.. satisfy a ghoulish fascination at the "dead" fat lady.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: August sure was right about Rosie. She pulled the people right in. Rosie played that crowd like a pro. The rubes love the exotic Rosie...kids run up to pet her their parents. As Rosie passes, we see AN OLD WOMAN standing in front of green shuttered house waving with delight. We see she has abundant vegetable garden which Rosie eyes covertly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR: The Band playing from inside the Big Top as the performers and ring stock are lined up for the Grand Spec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as soon as the Spec started, we all knew it was too soon for Rosie's debut. Rosie heads the line. Marlena sits atop her, in her sequi and headdress, grabbing onto Rosie's leather halter.

August stands beside with the bull hook. His face is cold still. His fingers clutch and release the bull hook. The SPEC MUSIC begins and everyone makes last minute adjustments...Kinko and Queenie included....August shouts into Rosie's ear.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: Rosie hesitates so August strikes her right shoulder with bull hook. The pain sends Rosie flying through the Big To flap, causing Marlena to adeptly flatten her back atop Ro so as not to hit her head on the pole that runs across th Big Top flap. Others gasp at the near accident. August is already furio Jacob senses danger ahead. He follows in, curling the edg the sidewall so as not to impede the Spec performers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob watches as Rosie makes it twenty feet down the hippodrome track then stops. Without missing a beat, Marlena yanks herself upright, be a smile and thrusts her hands in the air, her back arched her toes pointed - as if it were all a part of the act. The crowd goes wild - clapping, throwing peanuts, whistli Rosie only moves in fits and starts, causing the rest of Spec to pass them by at times. She trots ahead of August then when August reaches her she stops, making August hal awkwardly. August feels humiliated until: The crowd laughs, thinking it's the act. They applaud. August realizes the crowd loves it. So August, the perfor starts to play the infuriated fool to the audience, actin comically angry and frustrated with Rosie.. But when he turns back to Rosie, he is red-faced with rea anger, poking under her shoulders with the bull hook. After three stops and starts, August plunges the bull hoo sharply into her shoulder blade...and Rosie takes off at faster speed, curling her trunk in the air. The crowd che

Marlena grasps Rosie's halter as they fast approach the dangerous pole above the entrance. If Marlena doesn't bai she'll be knocked off by the pole. Jacob, August, the Spec and the audience watch enthralled Rosie charges toward the entrance...when suddenly: Marlena lets go of the halter and leans hard to the left. Just as Rosie bolts out of the Big Top, Marlena grabs hol the pole above the entrance and is left hanging there as Rosie exits the Big Top... For a moment, the audience doesn't know if this is part o the act. Jacob wants to run to help her... But Marlena quickly decides what to do; She lets go of th pole with her left hand and quickly swings around so she facing the audience, still hanging from the pole. Her face lights up and she points to her toes. The Band Leader takes this as a signal and conducts the band into drum roll. The crowd relaxes and applauds. Marlena begins swinging, gaining momentum as the band rol mounts. Soon, in one final burst of performance inspirati she releases herself from the pole, sails through the air tucking her body into a ball, rolling twice, uncurling fo one sideways rotation and lands firmly in the sawdust in feet. She straightens up and thrusts her arms in the air. The crowd goes wild. The Band plays victory music. Coins thrown from the bleachers. Even the Spec performers cheer August acknowledges the audience's response by bowing as it were all his creation. But after a moment, Jacob can see Marlena is in pain as s turns and subtly limps out of the Big Top. He follows her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob rushes to her. Marlena, in pain, collapses in his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jacob... August rushes out and is stopped cold by the sight of Marlena in Jacob's arms. He immediately tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, she's hurt. August takes her in his arms. Barbara appears to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, darling, I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her to my tent, it's closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, send Joe for ice. You go and find that Goddamn bull before we're run out town. And take the hook! August is seething, his expression cold, as he carries Marlena O.S. Jacob, concerned, takes the hook and runs O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie is standing in a vegetable garden calmly feeding herself cabbages. The owner is the OLD WOMAN who was delighted by Rosie in the parade. She is now screaming hitting her with a small garden shovel...Jacob runs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry ma'am. I'll get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better before she gets at my --

dialogues.speaker: AAHHH, MY TOMATOES
dialogues.text: Rosie has helped herself to tomatoes. Jacob steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie, no! Stop! Rosie pauses for a moment, flapping her ears at Jacob, th shoves a bush of tomatoes in her mouth. Jacob almost laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad elephant, that's not nice. This kind lady hasn't invited you.

dialogues.speaker: MY HOUSE
dialogues.text: She exits into the house as Rosie wraps her trunk around cabbages, uprooting them, as Jacob tries to battle her tr Greg arrives with a bucket he places in front of Rosie. H trunk stops fighting Jacob and sniffs inside the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the bucket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin and ginger ale. Elephants love booze. One whiff of this and she's not thinking about cabbages no more. (Bats her trunk away) ... moj malutki paczuszek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, right? Are you Polish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabowski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jankowski. Greg again pushes Rosie's trunk away from the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last show I worked, one bull faked a belly ache just to get the whiskey...Better grab the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a bull man? August would hire you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want the job. Not for him. Besides, I'm not bull man. I just like big beasts. Jacob gets it and follows Greg who carries the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she following? Jacob turns around to see and sure enough: Rosie is leaving the garden and trotting behind to catch to the bucket of gin and ginger ale. Jacob's impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show is still in progress - we can hear the band play for the aerialist act in the background.
As Jacob makes his way to Marlena's stateroom he crosses paths with August, whose face is "dark as thunder".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Marlena?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little shaky. Sore wrists. Bruised heel. Doc says she'll be fine. Did you catch the bull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the menagerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. August takes the bull hook from Jacob and walks with cold blooded intent towards the menagerie. Jacob panics, reali what August about to do. Jacob follows to stop him;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August! Wait! She was good! She came back on her own! Besides, you can't do anything now! The show is still going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. The band will drown it out.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST, NO
dialogues.text: Jacob touches August's arm. August turns on Jacob with a murderous expression, shoving him to the ground. Jacob is about to get up to fight but August cautions him with the bull hook to stay down. August smiles slightly. Would he really use that bull hook on Jacob or is he kidding? Jaco stays down. August continues on, entering the menagerie t

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jacob! Jacob sees Marlena running towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Marlena run across the grounds to the menagerie workmen are running out of the menagerie tent, hearing Au screaming from inside. They enter the menagerie tent to s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August is beating Rosie, who cries out with each blow. Th animals are panicking from inside their cages - the lions roaring, the monkey's squealing. Marlena freezes at the entrance as Jacob runs to August.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST...STOP
dialogues.text: August turns to see her. Enraged, he stops Jacob with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out of here! NOW! Jacob wants to help Rosie but can not disobey August in t moment. He returns to Marlena and ushers her out, as Augu continues to beat Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena and Jacob step away, hearing Rosie cry out. Marle can't bear it. She grabs Jacob's hand for support. Jacob tentatively holds onto her waist, guiding her away. She l into him. Jacob loves being this close to her. The screams of August O.S. pull their attention to see: Earl and his men physically dragging a maniacal August ou the tent, his bull hook and clothes bloodied by his rage. is kicking and struggling against them like a madman. Jacob is shocked by August's behavior. But Marlena has se it before. She pulls away from Jacob and exits O.S. alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie is lying on her side, her foot still chained to the stake. She is quivering, riddled with bloodied holes. Jacob is kneeling, applying zinc ointment, not knowing wh he can touch that won't hurt her. He is heart broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie, what am I going to do with you? Rosie's eyes look up to him, her lashes blinking. Her tru lifts and wipes at her own eye.
Greg appears with a bucket and several bottles of whiskey begins pouring whiskey bottles into a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here this will help. Poor beast. He really hurt her. Told you about him. (Curses August in POLISH) Don't understand why a man like that wants to be around animals in the first place. He shouldn't have the right, if you ask me. Listening to Greg, Jacob gets increasingly angry. He sees bull hook. He grabs it and marches out of the menagerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl's men are smoking, when one sees Jacob marching angr towards August's stateroom, carrying the bull hook. Alert

dialogues.speaker: EARL'S MAN
dialogues.text: Somebody better find Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob reaches the platform to find the door ajar. He move through it. The stateroom is in a shambles. An open suitc of women's clothes lies strewn across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Marlena...! August appears from behind the curtain ; he looks uncharacteristically distraught...teary eyed and unkempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Marlena is? Did she send you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No....What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't speak to me... He can't finish. He sits, burying his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She won't let me apologize... She won't forgive me.
Jacob is astounded by August's sad, pitiable state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happens to me, Jacob. When I saw that bull running wild with Marlena, I...I lost my mind. But it's because I love her. Why can't she understand that? (Jacob stands coldly) Isn't there anyone who understands? (Jacob remains silent) Ah, it's all my fault, I know it is. I've spent too much money on that bull. I can't pay the workmen. Our debts are piling. We're losing attendance at every show. I have no Star Attraction. I don't know what's going to happen to us if Rosie doesn't sell tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I lose this circus, I'll lose Marlena - I know it. Jacob softens, seeing August in this helpless, humble lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can talk to her. She's tired of my apologies but, this pressure I'm under...Of course, that's no excuse for what I did... (Rubs the images away) ...I can't believe what I did. Is she all right? The bull. Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell Marlena? And tell her...tell her I'll do anything. Anything she wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she'll forgive you...She loves you...Anyone can see that. August wants to believe him. He seems more hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. My friend. Jacob nods, confused, his anger diffused. As he exits;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob? Jacob stops and turns back as August asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you planning to do with that bull hook? Jacob realizes he's holding the bull hook. August smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. You look like me. Jacob looks in the mirror and indeed - with Rosie's blood his open shirt, bull hook in hand - he looks like a viole man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there is someone who understands me. August smiles. But Jacob is unnerved by the smile...and t comparison. Suddenly, Earl enters and looks around, on al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, Earl. August nods to Jacob, who pushes past Earl to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob jumps down off the platform. Confused and disgusted takes the bull hook, wedges it under the train and breaks in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters to find Greg still treating Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh she's a strong one, this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jestes dobra dziewczynka Jacob watches as Rosie lifts her foot and Greg rubs ointm Jacob sees the many empty whiskey bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's four tons..she'll just sleep good. (Screwing ointment top) Potoz noge. Jacob watches as Rosie puts her foot back on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masz, moja piekna Jacob watches as Greg digs in his pocket and pulls out a mint, brushing off the lint. Rosie's trunk investigates, nimbly plucks it out of his hand and into her mouth. SUDDENLY, JACOB HAS AN EPIPHANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MIDWAY
dialogues.text: An excited Jacob is leading August to the menagerie tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob leads August to Rosie. A curious Greg stops tending Rosie. Jacob hands August a slip of paper with Polish wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just read those out loud. To Rosie. August reads the words in Polish with Jacob's help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie...da--da---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daj.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daj...daj..no-ge. Rosie does nothing. August looks to Jacob. Jacob is worri Greg suggests, in a low whisper;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might help if he said please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say...Prosze Rosie daj noge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pros--Prozze Rosie...daj noge. Rosie lifts her foot. August's eyes gleam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reads and recites) Rosie...potoz noge. Rosie puts her foot down. August starts to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reads and recites) Do tylu, Rosie! Do tylu! Rosie sighs, shifts her weight, then takes a couple of st backward. August is amazed. Jacob is thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That Fox Bros bull man didn't tell us was the elephant tramp who sold Rosie to them was Polish... August grabs Jacob and kisses him on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a new star! Greg remains cautious. PRE-LAP : LIVE JAZZ BAND MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The live band plays on a raised platform. The dance floor jammed with couples.

Tables and U-shaped booths surround the dance floor. Tuxe bartenders serve from a wooden bar lined with hundreds of bottles in front of a smoky mirror. August, Jacob and Marlena sit in a booth. They are drunk their third bottle of champagne. Marlena is wearing a beautiful, low cut beaded red gown. Jacob can barely keep eyes off of her. Marlena is particularly drunk - we've never seen her this wild or spontaneous. She sings along with the band...she keeps rhythm by banging her hands on the table. However, she is acting distant to August. August is happy she is having a good time. When he slides next to her and puts his arm around her, Marlena stiffens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to dance, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Awkward beat. Marlena takes her champagne glass and drink the last of it. August tries to make light of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you stay with Marlena. August kisses her cheek, but Marlena is clearly still ups August lets her be. He exits O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever going to let him off the hook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook? That's an unfortunate choice of words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie's going be great. He won't hurt her again. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, what you know about August is pretty much nothing.
Jacob feels put down. Marlena realizes that came out too brusquely. She softens, and explains with vulnerability;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how many star acts we've had? How much money we've made and lost and made...? Silver Star paid for our new stateroom and look what happened to him. Everything August touches gets fed to the cats one way or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never change. Jacob is moved. Marlena shifts gears and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should wait for August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to dance now! She pulls him up onto the dance floor. Marlena dances lig as air. She spins from Jacob then returns to his arms, so that her back is to him. Jacob's forearm is on her collar - skin to skin. Her chest rises and falls under his arm. hair under his chin, Jacob can smell her fragrance - then unwinds away from, like a ribbon. When the music stops, everyone applauds their dance - including Marlena. Jacob beams. He looks up to the bar: August stands stock still. His eyes glaring at Jacob. The dark expression we've come to know. Seething with quiet r Jacob takes a step back from Marlena when suddenly they h

dialogues.speaker: RAID
dialogues.text: PANDEMONIUM: Jacob is swept by a crush of bodies. People scream, shoving their way towards the exit. Marlena is sh along with them, a few heads in front of Jacob. Jacob reaches through the sea of flesh and grabs a hand. Marlena's expression, we know he has grasped her hand. Ja scans the panicked crowd for August but all he sees are strangers running in every direction, people screaming.. Jacob's hand is ripped apart from Marlena at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is thrown into the alley. People are piling into ca engines are starting, wheels squealing. Suddenly, Marlena appears, grabbing Jacob's hand. She tak off her shoes. They run through back streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run under a fire escape, panting, out of breath. The sirens and screams of the crowd are distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, that was close...Aw, look at my stockings! And they're silk too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if August got out... Marlena looks up at Jacob and starts laughing hystericall as if for no reason. They are both still drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know how we're going to get home. I've never been in New York, have you? Marlena's laughing subsides as she gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what about August?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is, do you? And he doesn't know where we are. It's not our fault. Like you said, who knows how long it'll take us to get back. Jacob is hesitant. Marlena takes his hand and softly plea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few hours, Jacob. For just a few hours, we don't belong anywhere...we don't belong to anyone...Please.
Jacob looks in her eyes and knows he shouldn't, but...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was doomed. He smiles. Marlena beams. They run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A summer storm with thunder and lightening is coming towa them from over the Hudson River. Marlena and Jacob are looking out at the expansive 1931 v of New York City. Other couples stroll about the sky deck Marlena breathes in deeply...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen so far. Have you? (Jacob shakes head) Look at it. As far as the eye can see and it's nowhere near all that's out there. Jacob notices tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No. Yes, hahaha I'm fine. I'm a complete mess...ha... THE THUNDER BREAKS AND THE RAIN BEGINS TO POUR... Suddenly, MARLENA SCREAMS as loud as she can, startling t other couples. Jacob laughs. Beat of silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. But Jacob understands; He screams and Marlena joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other couples leave the sky deck to get out of the ra and away from "that crazy couple". Marlena and Jacob stop, wet, panting, laughing from the release. Then, looking out at the view, not at each other
Marlena begins to confess what she needs Jacob to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob? I need you to do something for me. Promise me you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go. I want you get away from us, from the show. You're smart Jacob. You deserve better than us. Leave as soon as you can or something terrible's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, confused) Why are you saying this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. No one can hear. We'll never get another chance to say it all. Marlena looks into Jacob's eyes and finally addresses wha they're both thinking;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can ever happen with us, you know. It's too dangerous. August will never let me go. You don't know what he's capable of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be with a man you're frightened of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I don't have to feel afraid of him if I don't feel anything...After all these years, I've learned how to do it so well. I tell myself, "I'm managing. I can manage him. August loves me. Nobody else ever did. Who am I to say it's the wrong kind of love?" .. See, there's no place for a woman like me in any decent kind of world. You know where they found me when I was a baby? ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In an alley behind a whore house in Baltimore wrapped in newspaper. No one even bothered to leave a note...This circus, my horses - this is the only kind of life I can have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August made a woman like me a star attraction...I'm lucky. And I'm safe...And I was fine - before you came. Jacob feels sorry and hopeful at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing that can cause a woman so much trouble as a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that good. And I don't want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. Good men don't wind up with much in the end except their goodness. Isn't worth much, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? ... Look what we've done to you already. She touches Jacob's face gently. Until this moment, they didn't realize how close they are to each other tracing Jacob's face with her hands, as he leans in closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserve as good a life any other girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I still a girl? I feel so old. They kiss. They stop and silently acknowledge where this going. As they move towards a secluded spot, they continu kiss in between lines;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can only be tonight. We have to go back. Promise me you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise you'll look in my eyes the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Jacob kisses her with his eyes locked onto hers...With Marlena's back pressed against the entrance, Jacob reache and locks the door. They sink to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena sits inside Jacob's embrace on the ferry, her hea leaning against his chest - their hands entwined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had money, if I could take care of you, would we be going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to be a Rockefeller... August would find me. He always does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried to get away before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob you promised. You said you understood it was only tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I do....I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob walks Marlena out of the port to a waiting cab. The stop a few feet from the cab. Jacob gives her all the mon in his pockets. Marlena looks at him as if for the last t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you when I was 17? Jacob smiles. They kiss not wanting to let go. Marlena pu away and runs into the cab. Jacob watches it drive away. EXT. MENAGERIE TENT - WEEHAWKEN, NJ - PRE-DAWN. Jacob reaches the circus. Everyone is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters the menagerie, heading straight for Rosie. H gets on the ground beneath her and lies down...Rosie rais her trunk to allow Jacob to lie beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: SAME LOCATION
dialogues.text: Jacob is asleep under Rosie when Walter wakes him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you sleeping here? Somebody's looking for you. INT. CANVAS CAR - WEEHAWKEN, NJ - PRE-DAWN. Jacob and Walter enter to find Bill and Grady hiding an ailing Camel in a dimly lit car. Jacob kneels down to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid. How nice to see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Camel. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, kid. Woke up a few days ago and my feet was all floppy. Jes can't feel'em right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It ain't just that though. It's other stuff too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like down there...man stuff? Camel, his eyes wide and fearful, nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him, doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamaica ginger paralysis. Jake leg. I've seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such thing. Is there Doc? Walter looks at Camel's empty "Jake" bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manufacturer started putting this plasticizer in it, or something, to get around regulations that Jamaica ginger extract not be sold as booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to drink this stuff, ya know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what the hell am I supposed to drink to stop the shakes? It's Prohibition and I ain't no Astor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK Camel. Tomorrow's payday. We'll get you some moonshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady don't lie to the man. If men were getting paid, Blackie wouldn't have tossed four of "em between Boonton and Weehawken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four?...Will he get better?
Walter looks at him, his expression says No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave him here. They'll red light him for sure. Jacob understands. He gets an idea and turns to Walter. Walter understands and reacts with an adamant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is walking quickly back to the performer train. Ja follows, trying to reason with him. Throughout the scene, they are looking out for Blackie's men and speaking low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, please. Blackie and his men only patrol the roustabout cars. They don't work the performer train. We can hide him easy until-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until when? What are we going to do with him? Shoot him like Silver Star? Because that's what he is Jacob. In a week, he won't be able to move his legs at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a son in Pennsylvania. Near Reading. We're playing there in three weeks. That's all he needs. Walter doesn't want to do this, but clearly can't say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right about you. You're going blow us all up...August got home tonight before you and Marlena. People are talking. Walter stalks off leaving Jacob unhinged by the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't be a clown. I should be a Goddamn fortune teller.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. COOKHOUSE TENT
dialogues.text: The cookhouse tent is divided into two sections by a curt One one side: working men and the buffet table of food. I made up of benches and bare wood tables with salt and pep shakers. The other side of the curtain is filled with performers. tables have a checkered tablecloth and flowers. Marlena is sitting alone, drinking a cup of coffee. Jacob approaches. He sits opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Jacob, how are you? Marlena smiles. Jacob senses others eavesdropping...but t table is far enough away, so they can't be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to, uh...Is there any chance I could speak with you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I...I just wanted to...Walter said people are talking about what happened...last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jacob, champagne completely overwhelms my senses..I always feel the better for it when I abstain. All I remember is getting pushed by the crowd and then running and getting a hole in my stocking. I don't even know how I got home. I don't remember a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I want to apologize for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha,ha Jacob, it's silly of you to apologize for my torn stockings. You weren't even there. Jacob is crushed by her reaction. Marlena maintains her upbeat facade. August enters with his tray of food and crosses to them. He is smiling like a man who has spent t night having great sex. August kisses Marlena right in front of Jacob. It is a lo sensual kiss...a holdover from their night together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slept like a baby after last night. Thank you my darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, please. We're in public. Jacob understands his meaning and is quietly devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, nothing to be ashamed of. Man and wife reuniting in the most sacred of marriage places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Marlena has forgiven me. All's well with the world again, right Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quite an adventure last night. I'm glad I didn't have to bail you out. How did you get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you two get separated? You were so close on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, sweetheart. We got pushed apart by the crowd. This older married couple brought me to the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to look them up and invite them to the show free of charge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll even pay for their transportation. I'd pay it a hundred times over to anyone who helped my wife to safety. Thank goodness she had chaperones. If anyone had harmed her, or even touched her, there's no knowing what I might do. Jacob makes note of the implication. Marlena ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Jacob coaches August from the sidelines, the compan performers and workmen watch August command Rosie in Poli

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...August said he would create an act for Marlena and Rosie that would have'em line up for miles... August and the company are delighted when Rosie lifts her foot...or walks forward, then backward..

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: His accent was awful but Rosie obeyed without fail. Marlena watches, full of excitement and praise for August instructs Marlena where to stand. He commands Rosie who l Marlena up with her trunk. Everyone cheers and applauds. Those near Jacob pat him on back, grateful that he saved the circus. Jacob smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was finally a part of them.

dialogues.speaker: PACKED HOUSE AS AUGUST LEADS THE WAY TO CHEERS AND APPLAU
dialogues.text: When they enter the center ring, they stop. August gives Rosie the command to lift Marlena down with her trunk. But Rosie hesitates. August commands her again, with more force. But Rosie doesn't move forward...she shuffles a fo backwards. August grips his silver tipped cane. Oh-oh...

Jacob and other performers watch anxiously. Will Rosie fa Then August turns to the audience and mimes apologizing t the crowd. When he back is turned, Rosie hits his butt wi her trunk. August freezes. The crowd laughs uproariously. Jacob and the others realize it's all part of the act. Wa slaps his back. Barbara kisses his cheek. August displays great performance skills. He turns to Ros acting suspicious. Rosie lifts her head away, as if to sa "It wasn't me". August turns back to the crowd to apologize and once agai Rosie flicks his behind with her trunk. This time August knows it her. He turns to her, tips his hat over his brow shakes his finger, scolding, as if to say, "No, no, no" Rosie responds by waving her trunk, mocking him. And the crowd bursts into applause. August commands Rosie, who lifts Marlena with her trunk a places her on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters of ROSIE and MARLENA highlight the act COMING SOO Blackie and his men are covering up the Posters of other circuses and town events.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: August could have given Barnum a run for his money. He spent the payroll money on expensive posters promoting that act like it was bigger than Ringling. And we sold out every performance in every town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena blows kisses to the audience. She skips theatrica around the ring, with Rosie trotting behind her, August hovering beside. Marlena stops and wipes her brow, feigning exhaustion, an sits on a small ball.

Rosie observes her with a smile and a raised trunk. Rosie copies Marlena's actions, placing her enormous rear down much larger ball. The crowd screams with laughter. Marlena stands in mock outrage, wagging her finger at Ros She turns her back on her, folding her arms. Rosie also stands and presents Marlena with her rear end facing the other way. The audience loves it.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In that center ring, Rosie became a guaranteed star attraction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits alone facing Rosie, in her massive stock car m of steel, talking to her, in Polish...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alone with me, telling her every thing I couldn't tell anyone else, she became the closest thing I had to family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena looks back and scowls. With dramatic flair, she raises one foot and places it on the small ball as if to "Take that, elephant!" Rosie, not to be out done (guided by August's Polish commands) curls her trunk, lifts her foot and places it o her larger ball. Marlena straightens out both arms and extends her other l like a ballerina's, toe pointed. She place the foot along the other, so that she is now standing atop the ball. Rosie waits a moment, then lifts her other front foot ont the ball. The crowd explodes! August pretends to be outraged with Marlena. But as showers of coins and money rain upon them August and Marlena stand beneath showers of glittering co

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And August! Ha, August was a new man..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workmen set up the circus with energy and renewed spi August treating them with pats on the back of gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..treating everybody first class, spreading the word his Rosie act would finally get the men paid..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, Walter and a Camel enjoy a card game and moonshine

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..And with business so strong, nobody was worried about getting tossed, so we didn't have to worry so much about old Camel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August is filling a bucket with gin and ginger ale for Ro JACOB (V.O.). And nothing was too good for Rosie. When August found out she liked gin and ginger ale, he made sure she got both every day, treating her like some favorite child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena does a double take, then lifts up her finger as i say "I have an idea!". With a rising drum roll, she shuf her feet atop the ball, moving herself around the ring... Rosie places all four of her feet onto the larger ball an rolls herself around the ring...Marlena and Rosie go fast and faster, along with the music... THE CROWD GOES WILD....August takes Marlena's hand and ki it as they take their bows.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I didn't trust the new August. I kept waiting for the real one to show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the darkness of the car, Rosie appears in the ligh being guided down the ramp by August, who gently pets her trunk, whispering in her ear. Her ears flapping, she purr with affection. Jacob watches.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was when I saw Rosie purring under his touch as if nothing had happened between them, that the worst thought occurred to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena and Jacob are laughing, listening to August telli story after a private dinner. Jacob glances at Marlena...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe, I was the man not to be trusted. Marlena moves to August's lap. They kiss...Jacob watches

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Marlena looked happy...And it broke my heart.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The circus is nothing without it's traditions..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August has gathered all the performers and trainers in a circle. Jacob stands in the center. Marlena beside August

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..It's a family. And like any family, when a new member is born, it's arrival must be greeted with celebration and gratitude. Now, we've been a little busy with sold out performances, thank the Gods..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..but right now I want to take this moment before today's show to gather together..We close our eyes.. Everyone closes their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..and we thank whoever's up there that sends desperate men running for the rails.. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..because it was a lucky day when Jacob Jankowski jumped our train. Because of him - together with our beautiful Rosie and my beloved Marlena - we have the greatest star attraction in Benzini Brother's history. He found a way to save us all. And so, to officially welcome Jacob into the family, we open our eyes.. Everyone opens their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..And we give him the traditional Benzini Brothers baptism.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FACE AND BODY. OTHERS THROW CONFETTI, STREAMERS...
dialogues.text: Jacob is a mess, covered in pies, seltzer and confetti. T company breaks up with laughter, applauds and cheers...Wa and Barbara bring Jacob towels, embracing and kissing him The rest of the company follows suit. August motions for Marlena, who retrieves a large mens clothing box and carries it to Jacob as August watches fr distance...The crowd parts as Marlena hands him the box. August watches Jacob open the box to find his own TUXEDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you don't have to borrow mine. Everyone applauds, hugging and kissing Jacob:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from both of us. Jacob looks to Marlena. It is awkward between them. They can't kiss each other. Jacob nods and says courteously;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Marlena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Jacob. As Marlena exits with the others, we discover August watc from them a distance; August's expression tells us he knows what they are hidin EXT. BIG TOP - SALEM, NJ - DAY. Marlena and Rosie exits the Big Top. We hear tumultuous applause coming from inside. Jacob awaits them, as usual. Jacob commands Rosie, who lifts Marlena off his back and places her carefully on the ground. Jacob pets and comman Rosie to follow him, but stops when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you could help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've planned a surprise for August. He's been so wonderful, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you make sure Rosie is staked in my tent after the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much...Oh, and I'm sure it would be nice for August if you were there too. Marlena turns and exits O.S. Jacob isn't sure what to thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie is staked into the grass inside Marlena's tent, hap occupied with a pile of watermelons. Marlena wears a silk beaded dress with the diamond neckla There is a serving table with silver domed platters and w bottles. Marlena is trying to open a champagne bottle whe Jacob enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he'll be here any second. Jacob, can you open this for me? Jacob takes the champagne bottle and manipulates the cork Rosie's trunk is curious, inspecting the bottle in Jacob' hand. Jacob laughs. Marlena sees and laughs as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie...get away....ssstop!! Rosie continues fooling around, causing Marlena and Jacob laugh even harder when the cork pops...

dialogues.speaker: AUGUST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What is this? Jacob and Marlena turn to see August enter, laying down h hat and coat, his shirt unbuttoned at the top.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Jacob pours the champagne into two flutes, which Marlena rushes up to August, handing him a glass and kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you show Jacob the opening night present I gave you? Marlena turns to Jacob and indicates the diamond necklace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the necklace) Oh. No...Do you see Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks stunning on you.
They kiss again. Marlena raises her glass of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To August - an authentic miracle man because he made a star attraction out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To August! August nods in gratitude. They tilt their glasses and dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many thanks. Forgive me for arriving too soon and spoiling the surprise. August takes out a cigarette and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. I couldn't wait for you to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could go back out to give you more time...or better yet, yell RAID and clear the place out so you two can be alone. In a split second, Jacob and Marlena know the danger pres August gave no sign of it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm probably wrong. I assumed that night after the RAID was the first time you two fucked, but obviously it's been going on longer than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie, you're being silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think I didn't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up. SHUT UP!

Marlena gets frightened. August saunters over to the silv tipped cane leaning against the flap. He picks it up as Marlena and Jacob remain still. Suddenly they hear: Rosie peeing where she is staked. She too is frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did you think you could keep this from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August, please, there's nothing-

dialogues.speaker: GO ON
dialogues.text: August swipes the tables with the cane, knocking all the platters and glasses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE!...So you two are a couple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I just don't think you're safe to be around a woman right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman? This is not a woman. This is my wife you Ivy League lying piece of shit! Say, I bet the authorities would like to know you practise without a license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie, please... Don't you see how much I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you. I see you too clearly. Always have. I have to admit that was a nice touch when you got back from the speakeasy. Being with me in our bed, after being with him. Covering your tracks. I should have known a whore only performs for a man like that when she wants something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena, come with me...

dialogues.speaker: TRAMP
dialogues.text: Marlena drops the fluted glasses, crying:

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he's quiet. He stands still. Marlena approaches now, cautiously but tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie? Are you all right now?... August looks at her. Marlena's expression is one of care concern. Jacob watches carefully. Has it passed? Suddenly, August flicks his lit cigarette into Rosie's op mouth - Rosie reacts and Jacob moves to help her - as Aug grabs Marlena, shoving her so hard she falls against the table, knocking it and her to the ground. He attacks her, trying to rip off her diamond necklace. Jacob attacks August, pulling him off of Marlena. JACOB AND AUGUST FIGHT: savagely pounding each other's fa crashing against broken plates and spilled gravy, banging their heads viciously against the ground, rolling over ea other as they alternately share domination... Marlena screams for them to stop. Rosie bellows, pulling her leg chain. The FIGHT SPILLS OUT OF THE TENT INTO THE CIRCUS GROUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and August continue beating each other as they roll into the crowd. August's madness empowers him. He manages to overpower Ja in a choke hold. Jacob is losing consciousness. Because of Marlena's screams - Earl and his men run to th tent. Within seconds, they are pulling August off of Jaco August gets to his feet. His cool expression is even more frightening as he re-enters Marlena's tent.
From inside the tent, they hear a crash. Marlena screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he won't, kid. Come on. Earl disperses the crowd that has gathered, which include Walter, who sees Jacob's bloodied face and goes to him. FROM INSIDE THE TENT, THEY HEAR: Two soft thuds..then a louder one...Then an unnerving silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's over. Can we let you go? Jacob pants and nods. Earl and one of his men let Jacob g degrees, until he is standing up. Walter holds his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Jacob. Walk away. With Walter's help, he tears his eyes from the billowing and walks away, passing rubes who watch with fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter uncorks a jug of moonshine and hands it to Jacob, holds a towel to his bloody, beaten face. Jacob drinks fr the jug, panting, until the pain subsides. Camel speaks f behind the trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing that's keeping you alive right now are the rubes who saw everything. August can't risk getting rid of you here. But you better not get back on this train when we leave tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: CAMEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What happened? Somebody turn me around. Share some of that jug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up Camel.

dialogues.speaker: CAMEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell...!
Camel uses whatever strength his has to push aside the tr and see bloody Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Who did that to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true? Jacob wants to deny it but his silence speaks the truth. can only manage to shake his head NO...But Walter can rea between the lines....He lowers his head in despair. THE TRAIN STARTS TO MOVE. All three react with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we moving? We have a matinee tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's gone wrong. SUDDENLY, A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. The three men immediately on alert. Walter grabs his knife from beneath his pillow. Camel tries to shove himself behind the trunks. THE KNOCK COMES AGAIN as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jacob? Jacob, it's Marlena. They breath a sigh. Jacob opens the door to reveal. Marlena with a black eye. Jacob rises to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I had nowhere to go. I told him I'm leaving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks worse than it feels. (Re: Jacob's face, laughs) Ha, look at the two of us. Marlena awkwardly enters the room to Walter and Camel's stares. She sees the moonshine and breaks the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a swig of that?
Walter throws her the moonshine. Marlena drinks like a pr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the train moving? Marlena sits with the jug, casually talking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being run out. Apparently, August was so optimistic about money coming in for Rosie, he figured he'd double down and find himself a new fat lady to put him really toe to toe with Ringling...So he sent Mr. Erwin into town who finds this rather large woman in a restaurant and offers her the job. Except, she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she was the police chief's wife. Mr. Erwin got a left hook in the jaw and we got til morning to get out of town. This cracks everybody up. Laughter. A release of tension. But the laughter turns to quiet sadness as the reality of their situation sinks in....Marlena looks to Jacob and le into his arms. He holds her, clearly in love, then ushers out of the room for privacy. Walter sees what he knew all along. He kisses Queenie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw girl. We're all in it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena and Jacob exit Walter's room outside of which Mar placed her small suitcase. They pass by Marlena's horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you hiding that roustabout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Blackie and his men don't work the performer train and they'll red-light him if they find him. He can't work anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.
They come upon Silver Star's stall - empty - right before door to the next car. They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does August know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He thinks I'm with Barbara and the girls. He won't go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't find you. As soon as we stop - before we stop - we'll jump off and I'll take you to a hotel in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after that? August has all our money. Where will I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena, I'm not leaving you. We'll find a way together. I won't let you go back to him. I promise. Marlena smiles, needing to hear him say those words. She embraces him, grateful. Jacob holds her tight, assuring;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I'll call my dean at Cornell..If I can take my finals again, get my degree, I can get my license. They lay in the Silver Star's empty stall. Moonlit throug the wooden slats. Making plans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jacob, that would be wonderful. You know, I bet Ringling would take us both then - they'd be getting a vet and a star attraction - that's a sweet deal for them. Although I won't be a star but I don't care. I'll take no billing at all...We'd be safe from August if we were with Ringling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'd have to wait a while until I can work again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob...I'm going to have a baby. Jacob is stunned...then confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours. Please don't ask me how I know...Is it all right? You can change your mind. I'd understand. Overwhelmed, Jacob keeps kissing her. Marlena lets go of the anxiety she had about him. He loves her. She knows it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change my mind??? Oh Marlena, please...please be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cries, relieved) I will...I promise...as soon as I stop being terrified. Jacob kisses her. He guides her to the ground, against th hay. She nestles in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest...I've got you now. Marlena tries, closing her eyes.....Then, without warning FROM THE ROOF, AUGUST, BLACKIE & HIS MEN JUMP IN THRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinko sits against the door, holding a trembling Queenie hearing the screams and struggle. Camel quivers in fear behind the trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy rain pours. A bloodied, battered Jacob is semi- conscious face down in a stream in the woods. Jacob, his eyes almost swollen shut, wakes out of unconsciousness. He looks up through blurred vision. Through the trees, he can see A DISTANT FLICKERING RED LI He stands. His knees buckle and he crawls out to the grou He stands again. And he walks out of the woods towards th flickering light. He stumbles and falls. He rises and fumbles forward...usi all his strength to get himself out of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob struggles out of the woods to a clearing. Squinting through the rain with swollen eyes, he sees:

dialogues.speaker: THE FLICKERING RED LIGHT IS A SIGNAL LIGHT ON A TRAIN TRA
dialogues.text: He walks, with legs barely able to move. He climbs up the gravel to the train tracks and begins to walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is walking on the train tracks in the direction of Marlena's train. He has walked all night and into the day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob - beaten, bloodied, exhausted - looks up ahead: THE BENZINI BROS. TRAIN and THE BIG TOP TENTS already set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pre-matinee. All the tents have been set up. The rub are filling the grounds. The midway is packed with people

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nell is sitting by an open window fanning herself from th heat when she sees: Jacob wandering behind the back of the train where no one see him....Nell watches as Jacob tries to reach the train then falls unconscious. Nell quickly brings Barbara to the window. Barbara sees J and immediately takes charge. Camera tracks Barbara and the girls through the windows, they walk through the car...Barbara is organizing a plan the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nell and two Coochie Girls hold their robes closed as the walk among the crowd. The Coochie girls head for Blackie his security men...They talk to them to distract them. We see Nell approach Walter in full clown make-up doing tricks with Queenie for the crowd. Nell whispers to Walte His expression tells us what we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara and the Tattooed Man sneak to the fallen Jacob wi blanket. They turn him over, shocked by his condition. Jacob's eyes open - he's delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Kid...Help me with him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delirious to Tattoo man) Don't you work the matinee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. I'm fading. I gotta re- ink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk. Jacob nods. They cover him, pick him up and carry him off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob opens his eyes. Walter is applying wet cloths to hi head. Camel watches nearby. Jacob suddenly rises;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlena!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshh. Lie back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Did he hurt her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Your pupils are two different sizes. Jacob pushes himself up onto his elbows but his world spi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get Marlena. What if he--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, look at me. You've got a concussion and you're on a moving train. There's nothing you can do. Marlena can handle him. She's done it for years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to have a baby. Walter is stopped. Camel shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does August know? (Jacob shakes his head) What have you done to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Ringling. Me, Marlena. You can too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
